Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Cogmaster
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: After a while, you don't see the cogs and sprockets. All you see is a robot, a spider tank, a deathray...

Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Freeze a minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Finicky Cloakfield

Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Light it up!" - Command given to both Lightwardens and Goblins holding Flamecannons.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Restore #3 Health. If the target is still damaged, summon a Lightwarden.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Reversing Switch
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Swap a minion's Attack and Health.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Rusty Horn
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Give a minion Taunt.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shadowbomber
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Shadowbomber does her job, but she's kind of phoning it in at this point.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Time Rewinder
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Warbot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Mass production of warbots was halted when it was discovered that they were accidentally being produced at "sample size."
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Enrage: +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Whirling Blades
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Give a minion +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Annoy-o-Tron
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The inventor of the Annoy-o-Tron was immediately expelled from Tinkerschool, Tinkertown, and was eventually exiled from the Eastern Kingdoms altogether.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt\nDivine Shield

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Anodized Robo Cub
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: It's adorable! AND OH MY GOODNESS WHY IS IT EATING MY FACE
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt. Choose One -\n+1 Attack; or +1 Health.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Call Pet
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Real hunters tame hungry crabs.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Draw a card.\nIf it's a Beast, it costs (4) less.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Crackle
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Snap! This card! Pop!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $3-$6 damage. Overload: (1)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Darkbomb
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you're looking to make an "Emo" deck, this card is perfect!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $3 damage.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Explosive Sheep
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: How is this supposed to work? Your enemies think, "Hey! Cute sheep!" and run over to cuddle it?
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to all minions.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Feign Death
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The hardest part about doing a "Feign Death" convincingly is learning how to make the right smell. It takes a lot of commitment.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Trigger all Deathrattles on your minions.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Flamecannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Calling something a flamecannon really doesn't do much to distinguish it from other goblin devices.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $4 damage to a random enemy minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gilblin Stalker
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Shhh, I think I hear something."\n\n"Ah, it's probably nothing." - Every Henchman
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Stealth

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Glaivezooka
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For the times when a regular bazooka just isn't enough.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Goblin Auto-Barber
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This guy is excellent at adjusting your haircut and/or height.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your weapon +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mechwarper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Mechs that summon mechs? What's next? Donuts that summon donuts? Mmmmm.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Your Mechs cost (1) less.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Micro Machine
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This card is the real thing.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the start of each turn, gain +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mistress of Pain
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Her sister is the Mistress of Pane who sells windows and shower doors.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Damage dealt by this minion also heals your_hero.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: One-eyed Cheat
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: When pirates say there is no "Eye" in "team," they are very literal about it.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you summon a Pirate, gain Stealth.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Puddlestomper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He pays homage to Morgl, the great murloc oracle! (Who doesn't??)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Recombobulator
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For when you didn’t combobulate quite right the first time around.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a random minion with the same Cost.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Seal of Light
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The walrus of Light restores EIGHT Health.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Restore #4 Health to your hero and gain +2 Attack this turn.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shadowboxer
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Punching is its primary function. Also, its secondary function.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever a character is healed, deal 1 damage to a random enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shielded Minibot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He chooses to believe what he is programmed to believe!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Divine Shield

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ship's Cannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you hear someone yell, "Cannonball!" you're about to get wet. Or crushed.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: After you summon a Pirate, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Shrinkmeister
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: After the debacle of the Gnomish World Enlarger, gnomes are wary of size-changing inventions.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a minion -2_Attack this turn.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Snowchugger
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Do the slow chant when he waddles by: "Chug! Chug! Chug!"
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Steamwheedle Sniper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Goblins seldom have the patience for sniping. Most prefer lobbing explosives.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Your Hero Power can target minions.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Stonesplinter Trogg
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The only thing worse than smelling troggs is listening to their poetry.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Unstable Portal
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The denizens of Azeroth have no idea how much work goes into stabilizing portals.  We spend like 30% of GDP on portal upkeep.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Add a random minion to your hand. It costs (3) less.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Vitality Totem
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: You can usually find these at the totemist's market on Saturdays.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Whirling Zap-o-matic
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you pay a little extra, you can get it in "candy-apple red."
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Windfury

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Bouncing Blade
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Only goblins would think this was a good idea. Even they are starting to have their doubts.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $1 damage to a random minion. Repeat until a minion dies.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Coghammer
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: So you ripped this out of a machine, carved some runes on it, stuck it on a handle, and now it's a weapon of great divine power? Seems legit.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a random friendly minion Divine Shield and Taunt.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Cogmaster's Wrench
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: For tightening cogs and smashin' troggs!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Has +2 Attack while you have a Mech.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Flying Machine
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: To operate, this contraption needs a hula doll on the dashboard. Otherwise it's just a “falling machine.”
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Windfury

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gnomeregan Infantry
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The gnomes are valiant and ready to return to their irradiated, poorly ventilated homeland!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Charge\nTaunt

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Gnomish Experimenter
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He's legitimately surprised every time he turns himself into a chicken.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. If it's a minion, transform it into a Chicken.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Goblin Sapper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He’s not such a binge exploder anymore. These days, he only explodes socially.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Has +4 Attack while your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Grove Tender
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Likes: Hiking and the great outdoors. Dislikes: Goblin shredders and sandals. (Can’t find any that fit!).
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Choose One - Give each player a Mana Crystal; or Each player draws a card.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Hobgoblin
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Hobgoblins are meeting next week to discuss union benefits.  First on the list: dental plan.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you play a 1-Attack minion, give it +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Illuminator
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "LUMOS!" is not what they yell. What do you think this is, Hogwarts?
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, restore 4 Health to your hero.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Iron Sensei
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Mechs like learning from him because he really speaks their language.\n\n0110100001101001
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of your turn, give another friendly Mech +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Lil' Exorcist
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Warlocks have the town exorcist on speed dial in case they unleash the wrong demon.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt\nBattlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each enemy Deathrattle minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Metaltooth Leaper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Don't leave them out in the rain. In Un'Goro Crater there is a whole colony of rust-tooth leapers.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your other Mechs +2 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Muster for Battle
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "I'm bringing the guacamole!" – One of the most successful (yet rare) Silver Hand rallying cries
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Summon three 1/1 Silver Hand Recruits. Equip a 1/4 Weapon.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ogre Brute
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Ogres have really terrible short-term chocolate.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ogre Warmaul
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Simple, misguided, and incredibly dangerous. You know, like most things ogre.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: 50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Powermace
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: People assume that shamans control the elements, but really, they have to ask them stuff and the elements are like, "Yeah ok, sure."
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deathrattle: Give a random friendly Mech +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Scarlet Purifier
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The Scarlet Crusade is doing market research to find out if the "Mauve Crusade" would be better received.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to all minions with Deathrattle.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Soot Spewer
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The inventor of the goblin shredder is involved in several patent disputes with the inventor of the soot spewer.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Spell Damage +1

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Spider Tank
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "What if we put guns on it?" -Fizzblitz, staring at the spider-transportation-machine

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Tinkertown Technician
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Won't you take me to... Tinkertown?
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, gain +1/+1 and add a Spare Part to your hand.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Velen's Chosen
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Velen wrote a "Lovely Card" for Tyrande with a picture of the Deeprun Tram that said "I Choo-Choo-Choose you!"
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Give a minion +2/+4 and Spell Damage +1.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ancestor's Call
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Hey! Ancestors!" - Ancestor's call
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Put a random minion from each player's hand into the battlefield.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Arcane Nullifier X-21
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: There was some hard talk between gnome magi and engineers about inventing this mech.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt\nCan't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Burly Rockjaw Trogg
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He's burly because he does CrossFit.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, gain +2 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Dunemaul Shaman
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He just closes his eyes and goes for it. Raarararrrarar!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Windfury, Overload: (1)\n50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Echo of Medivh
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Medivh's echo haunts Karazhan, eternally cheating at chess and Hearthstone.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Put a copy of each friendly minion into your hand.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Enhance-o Mechano
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: His enhancements are gluten free!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions Windfury, Taunt, or Divine Shield\n(at random).

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Fel Cannon
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The box says, "New and improved, with 200% more fel!"
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to a non-Mech minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Goblin Blastmage
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If you can't find a bomb to throw, just pick up any goblin invention and throw that.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: If you have a Mech, deal 4 damage randomly split among all enemies.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Imp-losion
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The shrapnel is waaaaay worse than the explosion.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $2-$4 damage to a minion. Summon a 1/1 Imp for each damage dealt.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Jeeves
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: This robot is a lean, mean, butlerin' machine.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the end of each player's turn, that player draws until they have 3 cards.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Kezan Mystic
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: They pretend to be wise and enlightened, but they mostly just hate to be left out of a secret.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Take control of a random enemy Secret.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Lost Tallstrider
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The message, "If found, please return to Mulgore," is tattooed on his rear.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mechanical Yeti
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The yetis of Chillwind Point are a source of both inspiration and savage beatings.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deathrattle: Give each player a Spare Part.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mini-Mage
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He is sometimes found hiding in the treasure chest in the Gurubashi Arena.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Stealth\nSpell Damage +1

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Piloted Shredder
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Once upon a time, only goblins piloted shredders. These days, everyone from Doomsayer to Lorewalker Cho seems to ride one.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deathrattle: Summon a random 2-Cost minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Sabotage
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Rogues can't stand it. They know you planned it! They are going to set you straight!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Destroy a random enemy minion. Combo: And your opponent's weapon.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Screwjank Clunker
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: If it breaks, just kick it a couple of times while yelling "Durn thing!"
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Mech +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Siltfin Spiritwalker
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The elements respond to anyone who calls them for a worthy cause, even if you call them by yelling, "MRGHRGLGLGL!"
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever another friendly Murloc dies, draw a card. Overload: (1)

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Tinker's Sharpsword Oil
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Get ready to strike oil!" - Super-cheesy battle cry
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Give your weapon +3 Attack. Combo: Give a random friendly minion +3 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Wee Spellstopper
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Bane of spellcasters and spelling bees everywhere.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Adjacent minions can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Antique Healbot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: They don't make 'em like they used to! (Because of explosions, mostly.)
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Restore 8 Health to your hero.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Blingtron 3000
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: PREPARE PARTY SERVOS FOR IMMEDIATE DEPLOYMENT.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Equip a random weapon for each player.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Bolvar Fordragon
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Spoiler alert: Bolvar gets melted and then sits on an ice throne and everyone forgets about him.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever a friendly minion dies while this is in your hand, gain +1 Attack.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Bomb Lobber
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He lobbies Orgrimmar daily on behalf of bombs.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to a random enemy minion.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Cobalt Guardian
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Guardians used to be built out of Adamantium, but production got moved to Gadgetzan and Cobalt was cheap.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you summon a Mech, gain Divine Shield.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Cobra Shot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Cobra Shot" hurts way, way, way more than "Cobra Cuddle."
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion and the enemy hero.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Demonheart
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Virtually every member of the pro demon lobby is a warlock. Weird.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion.  If it's a friendly Demon, give it +5/+5 instead.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Druid of the Fang
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: The Druids of the Fang live in the Wailing Caverns. They wear cool snake shirts and tell snake jokes and say "bro" a lot.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: If you have a Beast, transform this minion into a 7/7.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Fel Reaver
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: So reaver. Much fel. Wow.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your opponent plays a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Floating Watcher
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: "Evil Eye Watcher of Doom" was the original name, but marketing felt it was a bit too aggressive.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever your hero takes damage on your turn, gain +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Hemet Nesingwary
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: It's hard to make a living as a hunter in a world where beasts instantly reappear minutes after you kill them.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Destroy a Beast.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Junkbot
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: One bot's junk is another bot's AWESOME UPGRADE!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever a friendly Mech dies, gain +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: King of Beasts
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He never sleeps.  Not even in the mighty jungle.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Gain +1 Attack for each other Beast you have.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Madder Bomber
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Dang, Bomber, calm down.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage randomly split between all other characters.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Mimiron's Head
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Do not push the big red button!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: At the start of your turn, if you have at least 3 Mechs, destroy them all and form V-07-TR-0N.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Ogre Ninja
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He didn't have the grades to get into ninja school, but his dad pulled some strings.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Stealth\n50% chance to attack the wrong enemy.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Quartermaster
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: His specialty? Dividing things into four pieces.
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Battlecry: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2.

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Salty Dog
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: He's recently recovered from being a "scurvy dog."

Goblins vs Gnomes.name: Siege Engine
Goblins vs Gnomes.flavor: Wintergrasp Keep's only weakness!
Goblins vs Gnomes.text: Whenever you gain Armor, give this minion +1 Attack.

The Grand Tournament.flavor: Hey!  Let me try that...

The Grand Tournament.flavor: Apparently it really was just a flesh wound.

The Grand Tournament.flavor: We like to call him "Wesley".

The Grand Tournament.name: Acidmaw

The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever another minion takes damage, destroy it.

The Grand Tournament.name: Captured Jormungar
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You can keep him, but you have to promise to feed him and clean out his tank every day!

The Grand Tournament.name: Chillmaw
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Chillmaw keeps trying to ruin the Grand Tournament, and she would've done it too, if it weren't for those dang kids!
The Grand Tournament.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all minions.

The Grand Tournament.name: Confessor Paletress
The Grand Tournament.flavor: She sees into your past and makes you face your fears.  Most common fear:  Getting Majordomo out of Sneed's Old Shredder.

The Grand Tournament.name: Eadric the Pure
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Nobody rocks a monocle like Eadric.

The Grand Tournament.name: Fearsome Doomguard
The Grand Tournament.flavor: They were originally called Cuddleguards, but they were not inspiring the proper amount of fear.

The Grand Tournament.name: Knight of the Wild
The Grand Tournament.flavor: He gets a discount on the tournament entry fee because he is his own horse.
The Grand Tournament.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, reduce the Cost of this card by (1).

The Grand Tournament.name: Skycap'n Kragg
The Grand Tournament.flavor: What's more boss than riding a parrot with a jawbone for a shoulderpad while wielding a giant hook-lance-thing and wearing a pirate hat?  NOTHING.

The Grand Tournament.name: Rhonin
The Grand Tournament.flavor: A masterless shamurai.
The Grand Tournament.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 copies of Arcane Missiles to your hand.

The Grand Tournament.name: Anub'arak
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Was actually a pretty nice guy before, you know, the whole Lich King thing.
The Grand Tournament.text: Deathrattle: Return this to your hand and summon a 4/4 Nerubian.

The Grand Tournament.name: Aviana
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Call her "Tweety".  She'll find it real funny.  I PROMISE.

The Grand Tournament.name: Icehowl
The Grand Tournament.flavor: This massive yeti just closes his eyes and charges at the nearest target.  The nearest Target is a couple blocks away and has sick deals on skateboards.

The Grand Tournament.name: North Sea Kraken
The Grand Tournament.flavor: You have no idea how tired this guy is of being released.

The Grand Tournament.name: Frost Giant
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Don't ask him about the beard.  JUST DON'T.
The Grand Tournament.text: Costs (1) less for each time you used your Hero Power this game.

The Grand Tournament.name: Varian Wrynn
The Grand Tournament.flavor: Leader of the Alliance!  Father of Anduin!  Also he likes to play Arena, and he averages 12 wins.

Basic.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.

Basic.name: Wild Growth
Basic.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!

Basic.name: Windfury
Basic.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.

Basic.name: Animal Companion
Basic.flavor: You could summon Misha, Leokk, or Huffer!  Huffer is more trouble than he's worth.

Basic.name: Arcane Intellect
Basic.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.

Basic.name: Dalaran Mage
Basic.flavor: You don't see a lot of Dalaran warriors.

Basic.name: Drain Life
Basic.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.

Basic.name: Fan of Knives
Basic.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.
Basic.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw_a card.

Basic.name: Frost Nova
Basic.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.

Basic.name: Healing Touch
Basic.flavor: 8 Health, no waiting.

Basic.name: Hex
Basic.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?
Basic.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.

Basic.name: Ironforge Rifleman
Basic.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"

Basic.name: Ironfur Grizzly
Basic.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"

Basic.name: Kill Command
Basic.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal\n$5 damage instead.

Basic.name: Magma Rager
Basic.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.

Basic.name: Raid Leader
Basic.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"

Basic.name: Razorfen Hunter
Basic.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.

Basic.name: Savage Roar
Basic.flavor: What do they roar? Nobody can quite tell, but it sounds like "Elephant Macho Breeze".  It's probably not that, though.

Basic.name: Shadow Bolt
Basic.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!

Basic.name: Shadow Word: Death
Basic.flavor: If you miss, it leaves a lightning-bolt-shaped scar on your target.
Basic.text: Destroy a minion with 5_or more Attack.

Basic.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
Basic.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!

Basic.name: Shield Block
Basic.flavor: Shields were invented because Face Block is USELESS.

Basic.name: Silverback Patriarch
Basic.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.

Basic.name: Warsong Commander
Basic.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.

Basic.name: Wolfrider
Basic.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.

Basic.name: Blessing of Kings
Basic.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?

Basic.name: Chillwind Yeti
Basic.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Basic.name: Consecration
Basic.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.

Basic.name: Dragonling Mechanic
Basic.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.

Basic.name: Fireball
Basic.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.

Basic.name: Gnomish Inventor
Basic.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!

Basic.name: Hammer of Wrath
Basic.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.

Basic.name: Hellfire
Basic.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.

Basic.name: Houndmaster
Basic.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.

Basic.name: Kor'kron Elite
Basic.flavor: The Kor'kron are the elite forces of Garrosh Hellscream. Let's just say you don't want to run into these guys while wearing a blue tabard.

Basic.name: Multi-Shot
Basic.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.
Basic.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

Basic.name: Oasis Snapjaw
Basic.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.

Basic.name: Ogre Magi
Basic.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Basic.name: Polymorph
Basic.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.

Basic.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
Basic.flavor: Sen'jin Villiage is nice, if you like trolls and dust.

Basic.name: Stormwind Knight
Basic.flavor: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".

Basic.name: Swipe
Basic.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to an enemy and $1 damage to all other enemies.

Basic.name: Truesilver Champion
Basic.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)
Basic.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore 2_Health to it.

Basic.name: Water Elemental
Basic.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.
Basic.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

Basic.name: Windspeaker
Basic.flavor: Is there anything worse than a Windspeaker with halitosis?

Basic.name: Arcanite Reaper
Basic.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.

Basic.name: Assassin's Blade
Basic.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.

Basic.name: Assassinate
Basic.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!

Basic.name: Bloodlust
Basic.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!

Basic.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
Basic.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.

Basic.name: Darkscale Healer
Basic.flavor: Healing is just something she does in her free time.  It's more of a hobby really.
Basic.text: Battlecry: Restore 2 Health to all friendly characters.

Basic.name: Frostwolf Warlord
Basic.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.
Basic.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each other friendly minion on the battlefield.

Basic.name: Gurubashi Berserker
Basic.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.
Basic.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3_Attack.

Basic.name: Holy Nova
Basic.flavor: If the Holy Light forsakes you, good luck casting this spell.  Also, you're probably a jerk.
Basic.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies. Restore #2_Health to all friendly characters.

Basic.name: Nightblade
Basic.flavor: Your face is the place you'd probably least like a dagger, and where rogues are most likely to deliver them.

Basic.name: Starving Buzzard
Basic.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.
Basic.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.

Basic.name: Stormpike Commando
Basic.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.

Basic.name: Tundra Rhino
Basic.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?

Basic.name: Archmage
Basic.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.

Basic.name: Boulderfist Ogre
Basic.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"

Basic.name: Dread Infernal
Basic.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion
Basic.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.

Basic.name: Fire Elemental
Basic.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.

Basic.name: Lord of the Arena
Basic.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.

Basic.name: Reckless Rocketeer
Basic.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

Basic.name: Starfire
Basic.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.

Basic.name: Vanish
Basic.text: Return all minions to their owner's hand.

Basic.name: Core Hound
Basic.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Basic.name: Flamestrike
Basic.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.
Basic.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.

Basic.name: Guardian of Kings
Basic.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!

Basic.name: Sprint
Basic.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.

Basic.name: Stormwind Champion
Basic.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.

Basic.name: War Golem
Basic.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?

Basic.name: Ironbark Protector
Basic.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.

Basic.name: Mind Control
Basic.flavor: Nominated as "Spell Most Likely to Make Your Opponent Punch the Wall."

Classic.name: Thoughtsteal
Classic.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke
Classic.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.

Classic.name: Thrallmar Farseer
Classic.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.

Classic.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Classic.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
Classic.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.

Classic.name: Unbound Elemental
Classic.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.
Classic.text: Whenever you play a card_with Overload, gain_+1/+1.

Classic.name: Unleash the Hounds
Classic.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.
Classic.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.

Classic.name: Vaporize
Classic.flavor: Rumor has it that Deathwing brought about the Cataclysm after losing a game to this card.  We may never know the truth.
Classic.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, destroy it.

Classic.name: Void Terror
Classic.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.
Classic.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both\nadjacent minions and gain\n their Attack and Health.

Classic.name: Ancient Brewmaster
Classic.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.

Classic.name: Ancient Mage
Classic.flavor: Sometimes he forgets and just wanders into someone else's game.

Classic.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
Classic.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!

Classic.name: Auchenai Soulpriest
Classic.flavor: The Auchenai know the end is coming, but they're not sure when.
Classic.text: Your cards and powers that restore Health now deal damage instead.

Classic.name: Bite
Classic.flavor: Chew your food!
Classic.text: Give your hero +4_Attack this turn and 4 Armor.

Classic.name: Blade Flurry
Classic.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer
Classic.text: Destroy your weapon and deal its damage to all enemy minions.

Classic.name: Cone of Cold
Classic.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.
Classic.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.

Classic.name: Cult Master
Classic.flavor: She may be an evil cult master, but she still calls her parents once a week.
Classic.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, draw a card.

Classic.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
Classic.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.

Classic.name: Defender of Argus
Classic.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.

Classic.name: Dread Corsair
Classic.flavor: "Yarrrr" is a pirate word that means "Greetings, milord."

Classic.name: Ethereal Arcanist
Classic.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.
Classic.text: If you control a Secret at_the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.

Classic.name: Keeper of the Grove
Classic.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.

Classic.name: Lightspawn
Classic.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?
Classic.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.

Classic.name: Mass Dispel
Classic.flavor: It dispels buffs, powers, hopes, and dreams.
Classic.text: Silence all enemy minions. Draw a card.

Classic.name: Master of Disguise
Classic.flavor: She's actually a male tauren.  People don't call him "Master of Disguise" for nothing.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Stealth until your next turn.

Classic.name: Mindgames
Classic.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.
Classic.text: Put a copy of\na random minion from\nyour opponent's deck into the battlefield.

Classic.name: Mogu'shan Warden
Classic.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!

Classic.name: Mortal Strike
Classic.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6
Classic.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.

Classic.name: Pit Lord
Classic.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.

Classic.name: Shadow Madness
Classic.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.
Classic.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.

Classic.name: Shadowflame
Classic.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!
Classic.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.

Classic.name: Silvermoon Guardian
Classic.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…

Classic.name: Soul of the Forest
Classic.flavor: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.
Classic.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

Classic.name: Spellbreaker
Classic.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.

Classic.name: Summoning Portal
Classic.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!
Classic.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).

Classic.name: Twilight Drake
Classic.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.

Classic.name: Violet Teacher
Classic.flavor: If you don't pay attention, you may be turned into a pig.  And then you get your name on the board.
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, summon a 1/1 Violet Apprentice.

Classic.name: Abomination
Classic.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.

Classic.name: Bane of Doom
Classic.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to_a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.

Classic.name: Big Game Hunter
Classic.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.

Classic.name: Blessed Champion
Classic.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.

Classic.name: Brawl
Classic.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?
Classic.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)

Classic.name: Captain Greenskin
Classic.flavor: He was this close to piloting a massive juggernaut into Stormwind Harbor. If it weren't for those pesky kids!

Classic.name: Doomguard
Classic.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.

Classic.name: Doomhammer
Classic.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.

Classic.name: Druid of the Claw
Classic.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!
Classic.text: [x]Choose One - Transform\ninto a 4/4 with Charge;\nor a 4/6 with Taunt.

Classic.name: Earth Elemental
Classic.flavor: Nothing beats rock.

Classic.name: Explosive Shot
Classic.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.

Classic.name: Faceless Manipulator
Classic.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.

Classic.name: Fen Creeper
Classic.flavor: He used to be called Bog Beast, but it confused people because he wasn't an actual beast.   Boom, New Name!

Classic.name: Force of Nature
Classic.flavor: "I think I'll just nap under these trees. Wait... AAAAAHHH!" - Blinkfizz, the Unfortunate Gnome

Classic.name: Harrison Jones
Classic.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.

Classic.name: Holy Wrath
Classic.flavor: C'mon Molten Giant!!
Classic.text: Draw a card and deal_damage equal to_its Cost.

Classic.name: Leeroy Jenkins
Classic.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.
Classic.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.

Classic.name: Nourish
Classic.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.
Classic.text: Choose One - Gain 2_Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.

Classic.name: Silver Hand Knight
Classic.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.

Classic.name: Spiteful Smith
Classic.flavor: She'll craft you a sword, but you'll need to bring her 5 Steel Ingots, 3 Motes of Earth, and the scalp of her last customer.

Classic.name: Stampeding Kodo
Classic.flavor: This Kodo is so big that he can stampede by himself.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy a random enemy minion with 2 or less Attack.

Classic.name: Starfall
Classic.flavor: Is the sky falling?  Yes.  Yes it is.
Classic.text: Choose One - Deal $5 damage to a minion; or $2 damage to all enemy minions.

Classic.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
Classic.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!

Classic.name: Venture Co. Mercenary
Classic.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

Classic.name: Argent Commander
Classic.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.

Classic.name: Avenging Wrath
Classic.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!
Classic.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.

Classic.name: Blizzard
Classic.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.
Classic.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.

Classic.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
Classic.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....
Classic.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.

Classic.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
Classic.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.

Classic.name: Frost Elemental
Classic.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...

Classic.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
Classic.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.

Classic.name: Hogger
Classic.flavor: Hogger is super powerful. If you kill him, it's because he let you.
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 2/2 Gnoll with_Taunt.

Classic.name: Holy Fire
Classic.flavor: Often followed by Holy Smokes!
Classic.text: Deal $5 damage. Restore #5 Health to your hero.

Classic.name: Illidan Stormrage
Classic.flavor: Illidan's brother, Malfurion, imprisoned him beneath Hyjal for 10,000 years.  Stormrages are not good at letting go of grudges.
Classic.text: Whenever you play a card, summon a 2/1 Flame of_Azzinoth.

Classic.name: Kidnapper
Classic.flavor: He just wants people to see his vacation photos.
Classic.text: Combo: Return a minion to_its owner's hand.

Classic.name: Priestess of Elune
Classic.flavor: If she threatens to "moon" you, it's not what you think.

Classic.name: Savannah Highmane
Classic.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.

Classic.name: Siphon Soul
Classic.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.
Classic.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to_your hero.

Classic.name: Sunwalker
Classic.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!

Classic.name: Temple Enforcer
Classic.flavor: He also moonlights Thursday nights as a bouncer at the Pig and Whistle Tavern.

Classic.name: The Beast
Classic.flavor: He lives in Blackrock Mountain.  He eats Gnomes.  That's pretty much it.
Classic.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 3/3 Finkle Einhorn for your opponent.

Classic.name: The Black Knight
Classic.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.

Classic.name: Windfury Harpy
Classic.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.

Classic.name: Ancient of Lore
Classic.flavor: Go ahead, carve your initials in him.
Classic.text: Choose One - Draw a card; or Restore 5 Health.

Classic.name: Ancient of War
Classic.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.

Classic.name: Archmage Antonidas
Classic.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
Classic.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to_your hand.

Classic.name: Baron Geddon
Classic.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.

Classic.name: Gladiator's Longbow
Classic.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.

Classic.name: Gorehowl
Classic.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!
Classic.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.

Classic.name: Prophet Velen
Classic.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.
Classic.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.

Classic.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
Classic.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.

Classic.name: Al'Akir the Windlord
Classic.flavor: He is the weakest of the four Elemental Lords.  And the other three don't let him forget it.

Classic.name: Grommash Hellscream
Classic.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.

Classic.name: Gruul
Classic.flavor: He's Gruul "the Dragonkiller".  He just wanted to cuddle them… he never meant to…
Classic.text: At the end of each turn, gain +1/+1 .

Classic.name: Lay on Hands
Classic.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.

Classic.name: Tirion Fordring
Classic.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.

Classic.name: Twisting Nether
Classic.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.

Classic.name: Alexstrasza
Classic.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.

Classic.name: Cenarius
Classic.flavor: Yes, he's a demigod. No, he doesn't need to wear a shirt.
Classic.text: Choose One - Give your other minions +2/+2; or Summon two 2/2 Treants with Taunt.

Classic.name: King Krush
Classic.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.

Classic.name: Lord Jaraxxus
Classic.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.

Classic.name: Malygos
Classic.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!

Classic.name: Nozdormu
Classic.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.
Classic.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their_turns.

Classic.name: Onyxia
Classic.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.
Classic.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.

Classic.name: Ysera
Classic.flavor: Ysera rules the Emerald Dream.  Which is some kind of green-mirror-version of the real world, or something?
Classic.text: At the end of your turn, add_a Dream Card to_your hand.

Classic.name: Deathwing
Classic.flavor: Once a noble dragon known as Neltharion, Deathwing lost his mind and shattered Azeroth before finally being defeated.  Daddy issues?
Classic.text: Battlecry: Destroy all other minions and discard your_hand.

Classic.name: Pyroblast
Classic.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.

Classic.name: Sea Giant
Classic.flavor: See?  Giant.
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each other minion on the battlefield.

Classic.name: Mountain Giant
Classic.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.

Classic.name: Molten Giant
Classic.flavor: He gets terrible heartburn.  BECAUSE HE IS FULL OF LAVA.
Classic.text: Costs (1) less for each damage your hero has taken.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Jinyu Waterspeaker
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Waterspeakers can tell the future! So the Jade Lotus employs them to speculate on the Auction House.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Chemist
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Sure you could have that Polymorph potion, but wouldn't you rather have this mystery potion?  It could be anything.  Even a Polymorph potion!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Add a random Potion to your hand.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kazakus
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The mysterious leader of the Kabal is NOT a dragon, and does NOT deal in illegal potions.  Any public statements to the contrary will be met with litigation and Dragonfire Potions.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck\nhas no duplicates,\n_create a custom spell.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kooky Chemist
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: #abs
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Lotus Illusionist
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: If you think her Illidan and Sylvanas cosplay is great, wait till you see her Reno Jackson!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]After this minion attacks\na hero, transform it into a\n_random 6-Cost minion.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Naga Corsair
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Hook-tails are nice and all but she keeps getting stuck on things.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Seadevil Stinger
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Pretty harmless unless you're a Seadevil.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: The next Murloc\nyou play this turn costs\n_Health instead of Mana.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Shadow Sensei
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: He used to be Aya's tutor, but she fired him for bugging her too much.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Tanaris Hogchopper
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The Hogchoppers are well-known throughout Kalimdor for being a real, actual group.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent's\nhand is empty, gain Charge.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Worgen Greaser
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Hair products are 79% of his monthly budget.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Alley Armorsmith
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The rent is cheap and she passes the savings onto YOU!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Taunt Whenever this minion deals damage, gain that much Armor.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Bomb Squad
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Please don't explode!  Please don't explode!  Please don't explode!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to an enemy minion. Deathrattle: Deal 5 damage to your hero.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Burgly Bully
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: He only burgles to pay the bills.  He is really just a bully at heart.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Whenever your opponent casts a spell, add a Coin to your hand.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Cryomancer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: She loves Frozen. I mean who doesn't?

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Doppelgangster
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Every me, get in here!"

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Drakonid Operative
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: His job is to spy on the Goons and the Jade Lotus, but he's OBVIOUSLY a dragon so it's pretty hard work.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If you're holding a\nDragon, Discover a card in\n_your opponent's deck.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Finja, the Flying Star
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The last true master of Finjitsu.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Stealth Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, summon 2 _Murlocs from your deck.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Grimestreet Enforcer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Sir, you don't have a permit to park your mount here."
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: At the end of your turn, give all minions in your hand +1/+1.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Grook Fu Master
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Grook Fu, the ancient Hozen art of bashing heads with a stick.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Ichor of Undeath
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Summon 2 friendly minions that died this game.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Songstealer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Gadgetzan Writer’s Award goes to the player who writes the most compelling fanfic about why this Arakkoa has a golden frog in his hand!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Knuckles
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: When confronted with accusations of performance-enhancing bananas, Knuckles replied, "I get my fruit from trees I knock down with my bare hands like everyone else."
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: After this attacks a\nminion, it also hits the enemy hero.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Lotus Agents
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Mostly, they stand around and look cool.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Discover a Druid, Rogue, or Shaman card.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Lotus Assassin
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: For 5000g, you can just give the Jade Lotus any name and they will assassinate and/or embarrass them.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Stealth. Whenever this attacks and kills a minion, gain Stealth.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Lunar Visions
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The true mystery of lunar visions is how there is nothing to watch when there are so many channels.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Draw 2 cards. Minions drawn cost (2) less.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Piranha Launcher
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: A great improvement over the guppy launcher.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Raza the Chained
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Could you do me a favor and get the keys from Kazakus?"
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x] Battlecry: If your deck has \nno duplicates, your Hero\n Power costs (0) this game.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Red Mana Wyrm
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: It has double the Attack.  "Go on."  And double the Health.  "Yes??"  And its trigger has twice the effect.  "WHAT???"  And it costs…  Five times more.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Whenever  you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Second-Rate Bruiser
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: He'll be a first-rate bruiser once he gets used to his contacts.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Taunt Costs (2) less if your opponent has at least three minions.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Shadow Oil
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Add 2 random Demons to your hand.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Spiked Hogrider
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Did you know the Hogchoppers compete every year at the Mirage Raceway?  They do.  It's a real group.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: If an enemy minion has Taunt, gain_Charge.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Streetwise Investigator
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Hmmmm…  Call it a hunch, but I'm starting to think that there may be some kind of criminal activity going on in Gadgetzan."

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Virmen Sensei
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: There is no carrot.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: White Eyes
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: My life for Aya!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Taunt\nDeathrattle: Shuffle\n'The Storm Guardian' into your deck.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Ancient of Blossoms
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: His new shampoo is really working!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Aya Blackpaw
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Though young, Aya took over as the leader of Jade Lotus through her charisma and strategic acumen when her predecessor was accidentally crushed by a jade golem.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Big-Time Racketeer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "It'd be a shame if someone disenchanted those Legendaries."

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Defias Cleaner
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: His house cleaning service is quite thorough.  Not a spot to be found... or any of your stuff!

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Dragonfire Potion
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: No one was brave enough to fire the dragon in person… so they made the potion do it.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Felfire Potion
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Kazakus has a squad of imps bottling Felfire round-the-clock and he *still* can't keep up with demand.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Fight Promoter
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Yeah, I can get you Knuckles.  No, no, he's been clean for *weeks*."
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If you control\na minion with 6 or more\n_Health, draw two cards.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Jade Behemoth
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: I think we should talk about the jade elephant in the room.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Crystal Runner
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: "Listen, I can cut you in on a little of this premium mana, but you can't tell my boss."
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Costs (2) less for each Secret you've played this_game.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kabal Trafficker
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: She ships illicit mana crystals around the world in packages marked: FUNNEL CAKE.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]At the end of your turn,\nadd a random Demon\nto your hand.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Leatherclad Hogleader
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The Hogchoppers, the terrors of Tanaris, can always be found at one tavern or another in Gadgetzan, refueling for totally real and legit adventures that they go on.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: If your opponent has 6 or more cards in hand, gain Charge.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Luckydo Buccaneer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: You can't just leave a Luckydo somewhere.  You gotta keep 'em with you!  Especially in Gadgetzan!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: If your weapon has at least 3 Attack, gain +4/+4.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Madam Goya
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: She has set up her Black Market here in Gadgetzan for one purpose, to make a KILLING when Beanie Babies make their inevitable comeback.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Choose a friendly minion. Swap it with a minion in your deck.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Wind-up Burglebot
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Don't blame the bot for his crimes...  Blame whoever keeps winding him up!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Whenever this attacks a minion and survives, draw_a card.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Wrathion
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Wrathion, son of Deathwing, is a dragon.  Why isn't he tagged as a dragon, you ask?  WHAT, ARE YOU TRYING TO BLOW HIS COVER??
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Taunt. Battlecry: Draw cards until you draw one that isn't a Dragon.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Abyssal Enforcer
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The Kabal print this on every package of illicit Mana Crystals: WARNING - DO NOT PUT WITHIN REACH OF ABYSSALS. THIS IS NOT APPROVED FOR USE BY FLAMING DEMONS OF ANY KIND.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to all other characters.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Don Han'Cho
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: The brilliant mastermind of the Grimy Goons, Han sometimes thinks about ditching the idiot Cho, but that would just tear him apart.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Battlecry: Give a random minion in your hand +5/+5.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Greater Arcane Missiles
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Wow, and I thought Arcane Missiles was great!
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Shoot three missiles at random enemies that deal $3 damage each.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Grimestreet Protector
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Some new asphalt should do the trick.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Inkmaster Solia
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Solia marks the Kabal with intricate tattoos that grant immense power. Also it makes it harder for other gangs to recruit from their numbers. BACK OFF, GOONS.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has no duplicates, the next spell you cast this turn costs (0).

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Jade Chieftain
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Seeing his Jade Golem grow up into the tall, handsome 6/6 standing before him was the proudest moment of his life.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Krul the Unshackled
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Spicklefizz pondered his life choices as he looked at the chain around his neck. "Become a warlock," they said. "You get to enslave demons," they said.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: [x]Battlecry: If your deck has\nno duplicates, summon all\n_Demons from your hand._

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Mayor Noggenfogger
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: This flavor text was randomly generated.  If it happens to form words and make sense, that is purely by chance.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Ichor of Undeath
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Summon 3 friendly minions that died this game.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.name: Kun the Forgotten King
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.flavor: Aya siphons a bit of Kun's soul to animate each golem in her Jade army. To his credit, he's being a great sport about it.
Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Choose One - Gain 10 Armor; or Refresh your Mana Crystals.

Mean Streets of Gadgetzan.text: Add 3 random Demons to your hand.
